title: COVID-19 Pfizer Vaccine
description: COVID-19 Pfizer Vaccine Appointments: MyChart Patient Portal Watson Clinic Highlands: 863-607-3346 Watson Clinic
cleaned_text: Watson Clinic is now administering bivalent COVID vaccines to qualifying pediatric patients 6 months to 4 years of age. These Pfizer vaccines are given as a three-dose series. Bivalent vaccines are designed to safeguard against multiple strains of COVID (original and omicron BA.4/BA.5 strains) and are now the only authorized type of COVID vaccine. The use of monovalent vaccines has been discontinued. The COVID shot may cause minor side effects in some children including pain, redness or swelling on the arm where your child got the shot, tiredness, headache, muscle pain, chills, fever and nausea. If your child experiences any of these side effects, you should ask their pediatrician for tips or non-aspirin medications that might be useful. Please note that these COVID-19 vaccines may not fully protect you until one to two weeks after you receive your third shot. It takes time for your body to build antibody protection after any vaccination. The Pfizer vaccines may be scheduled at the below location: Schedule an appointment by calling one of the Pediatric appointment lines listed above. Please see below for more information on vaccine eligibility as established by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration: Children who are unvaccinated may receive a three-dose series of the Pfizer-BioNTech bivalent vaccine (6 months through 4 years of age). However, for immunocompromised individuals 6 months through 4 years of age, eligibility for additional doses will depend on the vaccine previously received.
